page.title: 06Panfield Church
page.content: On the 6th June a small group of children went to visit Panfield Church, which lies at one end of the village, near{Panfield Hall.}The vicar,{Rev Ronald Oswald}showed us around. The church was built in{1277}on the site of another church. It contains several graves of the{Cotton and{Langham}families who lived at {Panfield Hall}in the 16th century. The east window replaces one blown out by a land-mine in the 2nd World War when most of the glass in the church was destroyed. The organ-chamber and vestry were added in the 19th century. {Sunday school}meets 3 weeks a month at 10a.m.,{Holy Communion}at 8 or 11a.m. and{Morning Prayer,}once a month at 11a.m. Each year a{Parish Fete}is held in the grounds of{Panfield Hall.
